item.title: GitHub Sealed Away Its Open Source Code In an Arctic Fault
item.description:
Publishing date: ‘2020-08-18’

Published on: ‘Futurism’

summary: ‘Earlier this month, the code management platform GitHub sealed away its archive of open source software in an Arctic vault so deep that they say it could survive a nuclear blast. The mildly-outlandish idea behind the move, Engadget reports, is to give a boost to future generations after a hypothetical civilization-ending catastrophe. Should that happen, whatever civilization emerges from the ashes wonâ€™t have to start from scratch and could instead tap the knowledge of modern-day coders and engineers.’

authors: ‘DAN ROBITZSKI’
